source.content: <doc att1="attr_val1" att2="attr_val2" att3="attr_val3"><?pi PI_data?><!--This is the 1st comment-->text-in-doc<aaa>elem_aaa_value</aaa></doc>

test-case.name: match-001
test-case.description: Test for //name match pattern.

test-case.name: match-002
test-case.description: Test "union" allowed in predicates as alternative to "|" even in 2.0 (See also match9053-err)

test-case.name: match-003
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of predicate, using attribute, in match pattern.

test-case.name: match-004
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of @attrib=value in predicate in match pattern.

test-case.name: match-005
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of node=value in predicate in match pattern.

test-case.name: match-006
test-case.description: Test of or in predicate of match pattern.

test-case.name: match-007
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of boolean not function in match pattern.

test-case.name: match-008
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of node!=value match pattern.

test-case.name: match-009
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of functions in predicate.

test-case.name: match-010
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of 2 predicates.

test-case.name: match-011
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of predicate with two conditions, one positional. suppress built-in template for text

test-case.name: match-012
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of boolean and in predicate.

test-case.name: match-013
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of id('literal') as match pattern.

test-case.name: match-014
test-case.description: Test use of id() in the branches of a union pattern

test-case.name: match-015
test-case.description: Purpose: Test that apply-templates goes down at least 15 levels. Suppress the default action on these. To suppress empty lines

test-case.name: match-016
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of large union.

test-case.name: match-017
test-case.description: Purpose: Show that a variable can be used in a match pattern, though not for the name test. The variable must be top-level, of course.

result.assert-xml: <out> Passed: a Failed: b Passed: c Failed: d </out>

test-case.name: match-018
test-case.description: LocationPath010 in NIST suite Purpose: Test a match patttern with a complex expression.

test-case.name: match-019
test-case.description: Purpose: Test step//step[predicate], with positional predicate, to show that position numbering applies "relative to the child axis", not //. Suppress text matching

test-case.name: match-020
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of 2 predicates, first one being positional. suppress built-in template for text

test-case.name: match-021
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of two predicates, second one being positional. suppress built-in template for text

test-case.name: match-022
test-case.description: Test of two predicates, both being positional. First predicate reduces the set to {a,c,e,g,i,k}.

test-case.name: match-023
test-case.description: Test of three predicates, all being positional. First predicate reduces the set to {a,c,e,g,i,k}.

test-case.name: match-024
test-case.description: Test of three predicates, all being positional. Different notation. First predicate reduces the set to {a,c,e,g,i,k}.

test-case.name: match-025
test-case.description: Test of three predicates, all being positional. Use last() for one. First predicate reduces the set to {a,c,e,g,i,k}.

test-case.name: match-026
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of three predicates, two being positional. Use last() for one. First predicate reduces the set to {a,c,e,g,i,k}. Second predicate, taken alone, reduces the set to {f,g,h,i,j,k,l}.

test-case.name: match-027
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of three predicates, two being positional. Use last() for one. First predicate reduces the set to {b,e,h,k}. Second predicate further reduces the set to {h,k}.

test-case.name: match-028
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of three predicates, two being positional. First predicate reduces the set to {a,c,e,g,i,k}. Second predicate further reduces the set to {c}. Third predicate, taken alone, reduces the set to {a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,i}.

test-case.name: match-029
test-case.description: , from an idea by Holger Floerke Purpose: // at start of match pattern should not affect selection of nodes.

result.assert-xml: <out> <foundX level="2"/><foundX level="4"/><foundX level="6"/> <found-X level="2"/><found-X level="4"/><found-X level="6"/></out>

test-case.name: match-030
test-case.description: , from an idea by Holger Floerke Purpose: // at start of match pattern should not affect selection of nodes. Suppress other X nodes Suppress other X nodes

test-case.name: match-031
test-case.description: , from an idea by Holger Floerke Purpose: // at start of match pattern should not affect selection of nodes. Suppress other X nodes Suppress other X nodes

test-case.name: match-032
test-case.description: Purpose: Use multiple levels of child axis in match patterns. Intermix 'child::' and default, but only with child:: in the middle.

test-case.name: match-033
test-case.description: Purpose: Use multiple levels of child axis in match patterns. Intermix 'child::' and default, but only with child:: on the tail.

test-case.name: match-034
test-case.description: Purpose: Use multiple levels of child axis in match patterns. Spell out 'child::' sometimes.

test-case.name: match-035
test-case.description: Show that xpath-default-namespace has no effect on attribute names in a match pattern

created.by: Michael Kay, based on an idea by Wendell Piez

test-case.name: match-036
test-case.description: Test for *:local-name match pattern (XSLT 2.0).

test-case.name: match-037
test-case.description: Test the pattern /div. (Operator keyword after "/")

test-case.name: match-038
test-case.description: Test the "union" keyword in a pattern (should not be recognized as an operator)

test-case.name: match-039
test-case.description: FileName: MATCH9053-ERR Test the "union" keyword in a pattern (should not be recognized as an operator) (See also match87)

test-case.name: match-040
test-case.description: FileName: MATCH9053-ERR Test use of an undeclared function in a pattern predicate

test-case.name: match-041
test-case.description: test a pattern that includes range variable declarations in a predicate default this is what causes the problem Ignore All Text Nodes
test-case.keywords: child-axis predicate ForExpr ancestor-or-self variable-reference preceding-sibling complex-expression

modified.change: Declared serialization requirement

result.assert-xml: <out><t>testvar: "the text to begin with"</t><t>testvar: "the text to begin with"</t><t>testvar: "the text to begin with"</t></out>

test-case.name: match-045
test-case.description: Bug 1069950 - patterns of the form ns:* ignore the node kind

test-case.name: match-046
test-case.description: Check that a template rule with negative priority is OK

test-case.name: match-047
test-case.description: Check that a pattern using the attribute axis in a step other than the last is OK (though it never matches anything)

test-case.name: match-048
test-case.description: Check that a pattern using child::document-node() is legal (though it never matches anything)

test-case.name: match-049
test-case.description: Test use of current() in the branches of a union pattern

test-case.name: match-050
test-case.description: Test match="$a//x" allowed in XSLT 3.0

test-case.name: match-051
test-case.description: Test match="$a" allowed in XSLT 3.0

test-case.name: match-052
test-case.description: Test match="doc('xxx')" allowed in XSLT 3.0

test-case.name: match-053
test-case.description: Test match="id(X,Y)" allowed in XSLT 3.0

modified.change: Add DTD dependency

test-case.name: match-054
test-case.description: Test match="element-with-id(X,Y)" allowed in XSLT 3.0

test-case.name: match-055
test-case.description: Test match="element-with-id(X)" allowed in XSLT 3.0

test-case.name: match-056
test-case.description: Test match="id(X)" with id-valued element

test-case.name: match-057
test-case.description: Test "union" allowed in XSLT 3.0 as alternative to "|" (See also match9053-err)

test-case.name: match-058
test-case.description: A trivial predicate of [true()] can affect the template priority

test-case.name: match-059
test-case.description: Tilde syntax used with node tests

modified.change: Replaced tilde with new syntax .[. instance of type]

test-case.name: match-060
test-case.description: Union pattern allowing nodetest or atomic value

modified.change: Change error code. In current spec this is a syntax error

test-case.name: match-061
test-case.description: xsl:number with from pattern using type pattern syntax

modified.change: Replaced tilde with new syntax .[. instance of type]

test-case.name: match-062
test-case.description: xsl:number with count pattern using type pattern syntax

modified.change: Replaced tilde with new syntax .[. instance of type]

test-case.name: match-063
test-case.description: Except pattern

modified.change: see bug 30110

test-case.name: match-064
test-case.description: Except pattern

modified.change: see bug 30110

test-case.name: match-065
test-case.description: Union pattern with predicate

test-case.name: match-066
test-case.description: Except pattern with predicate

test-case.name: match-067
test-case.description: Filtered "/" in pattern

test-case.name: match-068
test-case.description: Filtered "/" in pattern. NOTE: this is allowed by the current (Oct 2012) syntax for patterns, but it is not a valid XPath expression. Bug 18861 proposes to make this pattern illegal.

modified.change: Changed to expect a syntax error, anticipating the revised spec

test-case.name: match-069
test-case.description: Parentless namespace node in pattern

test-case.name: match-070
test-case.description: doc() function in pattern

test-case.name: match-071
test-case.description: doc() function in pattern

test-case.name: match-072
test-case.description: global variable reference as pattern

test-case.name: match-073
test-case.description: global variable reference as pattern

test-case.name: match-074
test-case.description: global variable reference as pattern

test-case.name: match-075
test-case.description: descendant axis in pattern

test-case.name: match-076
test-case.description: descendant axis in pattern

test-case.name: match-077
test-case.description: FileName: MATCH9053-ERR Test use of an disallowed function at the start of a pattern

modified.change: change test to fulfil original intent (root() is now legal)

test-case.name: match-078
test-case.description: Following match pattern is legal but can't match anything. Despite the name, this is not an error case. (Saxon gives a warning)

test-case.name: match-079
test-case.description: FileName: MATCH9053-ERR Test that second argument to key() in a pattern must be a literal

test-case.name: match-080
test-case.description: FileName: MATCH9058-ERR Test function call not at the start of a pattern path

test-case.name: match-081
test-case.description: Union operator not at top level of pattern, not allowed in 2.0

test-case.name: match-081a
test-case.description: Union operator not at top level of pattern, allowed in 3.0

test-case.name: match-082
test-case.description: Test parens at top level of pattern, not allowed in 2.0

test-case.name: match-082a
test-case.description: Test parens at top level of pattern, allowed in 3.0

modified.change: See bug 28335
Bug 28335, fix XSLT version in stylesheet and multiple-match issue (parens do not change priority)

test-case.name: match-082b
test-case.description: Test parens at top level of pattern, allowed in 3.0, multiple match, catch error in xsl:try

test-case.name: match-082c
test-case.description: Test parens at top level of pattern, allowed in 3.0, multiple match, throw error

test-case.name: match-083
test-case.description: Test match="$a//x" disallowed in XSLT 2.0

test-case.name: match-084
test-case.description: Test match="$a" disallowed in XSLT 2.0

test-case.name: match-085
test-case.description: Test match="$a//x" disallowed in XSLT 2.0

test-case.name: match-086
test-case.description: Test match="id(A,B)" disallowed in XSLT 2.0

test-case.name: match-087
test-case.description: Test match="/[x]" (currently allowed by XSLT 3.0 specification, but not legal XPath - see spec bug 18861)

test-case.name: match-088
test-case.description: Test of pattern with kind document-node()

test-case.name: match-089
test-case.description: Test of patterns with kind test attribute()

test-case.name: match-090
test-case.description: Test match patterns with kindtest element()

test-case.name: match-091
test-case.description: Test match patterns with nametest *:NCName

test-case.name: match-092
test-case.description: Test match patterns with operator "eq" apperaing inside predicate

test-case.name: match-093
test-case.description: Test match patterns with operator "ne" apperaing inside predicate

test-case.name: match-094
test-case.description: Test match patterns with operator "lt" apperaing inside predicate
test-case.keywords: child-axis predicate ValueComp AndExpr fn:not fn:position

test-case.name: match-095
test-case.description: Test match patterns with operator "le" apperaing inside predicate

test-case.description: Test match patterns with operator "gt" apperaing inside predicate

test-case.description: Test match patterns with operator "ge" apperaing inside predicate

test-case.description: Test match patterns with rangeExpr inside predicate

test-case.description: Test of pattern with current() appearing inside predicate

test-case.name: match-100
test-case.description: Test predicates of document node

test-case.name: match-101
test-case.description: Test predicates of various parentless nodes
test-case.keywords: parentless-nodes ElementTest PITest priority TextTest CommentTest

test-case.name: match-102
test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless element node

test-case.name: match-103
test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless attribute node
test-case.keywords: parentless-nodes ElementTest attribute-axis PITest TextTest priority

test-case.name: match-104
test-case.description: Test match patterns with function id() invloving variable reference

modified.change: Add DTD dependency

test-case.name: match-105
test-case.description: Test match patterns with function key() using variable reference as argument

test-case.description: Test predicates of various parentless copied nodes
test-case.keywords: parentless-nodes ElementTest PITest TextTest AttributeTest CommentTest

test-case.name: match-107
test-case.description: Test predicates of various parentless nodes
test-case.keywords: parentless-nodes child-axis ElementTest PITest TextTest CommentTest

test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless element node using explicit child axis

test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless element node, using implicit child axis

test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless attribute node with attribute axis and the NodeTest in PatternStep is various KindTest
test-case.keywords: parentless-nodes attribute-axis ElementTest PITest TextTest CommentTest AttributeTest

test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless attribute node with attribute axis and the NodeTest in PatternStep is NameTest "*"
test-case.keywords: parentless-nodes attribute-axis ElementTest PITest TextTest Wildcard

test-case.name: match-112
test-case.description: Test predicates of various parentless copied nodes
test-case.keywords: parentless-nodes child-axis PITest ElementTest TextTest CommentTest AttributeTest

test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless copied attribute node with attribute axis and the NodeTest in PatternStep is various kindTest
test-case.keywords: parentless-nodes attribute-axis ElementTest PITest TextTest CommentTest AttributeTest

test-case.name: match-114
test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless copied element node

test-case.name: match-115
test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless copied element node with the use of explicit child axis

test-case.name: match-116
test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless copied element node with implicit use of child axis

test-case.name: match-117
test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless copied attribute node with attribute axis

modified.change: make expected results independent of attribute order

test-case.name: match-118
test-case.description: Test predicates of parentless copied attribute node with attribute axis

modified.change: make expected results independent of attribute order

test-case.name: match-119
test-case.description: Test of template matching with ForExpr inside predicate

test-case.name: match-120
test-case.description: Test match patterns with ForExpr inside predicate

test-case.name: match-121
test-case.description: Test match patterns with ifExpr inside predicate

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with nodeComp operator inside predicate

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with generalComp operator inside predicate

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with instanceOf and cast operator inside predicate

test-case.description: Test of select in xsl:value-of with set operations: except and intersect inside predicate

test-case.name: match-126
test-case.description: Test match patterns with current function inside predicate

test-case.name: match-127
test-case.description: Simple case of apply-templates to atomic values

test-case.name: match-128
test-case.description: Precedence of rules that match atomic values

test-case.name: match-129
test-case.description: Union pattern that matches atomic values

modified.change: Eliminate use of '~' syntax, and change error code.

test-case.name: match-130
test-case.description: Matching atomic values with a predicate

test-case.name: match-131
test-case.description: Priority of ~integer[. gt 0]; and next-match

test-case.name: match-132
test-case.description: Integer predicate in type pattern (rules were unclear, see bug 12455)

modified.change: See bugs 28366 and 12455
Bug 28336, fix non-matching numeric predicate in PredicatePattern

test-case.name: match-133
test-case.description: xsl:apply-imports with atomic value as context item

test-case.name: match-134
test-case.description: group-starting-with matching atomic value

test-case.name: match-135
test-case.description: group-ending-with matching atomic value

test-case.name: match-136
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element( * ,$type) where $type has no prefix and it belongs to no namespace.

test-case.name: match-137
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element( * ,$type) where $type has no prefix. Show there is no effect of default namespace of stylesheet on $type.

test-case.name: match-138
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name ,$type) where $name has no prefix.

test-case.name: match-139
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name ,$type) where $name has no prefix. Show there is no effect of the default namespace of stylesheet on $name.

test-case.name: match-140
test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-element($name) where $name has no prefix and it belongs to no namespace.

test-case.name: match-141
test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-element($name) where $name has no prefix. Show there is no effect of default namespace of stylesheet on $name.

test-case.name: match-142
test-case.description: Test of template matching with document-node(element( * ,$type)) where $type has no prefix and it belongs to no namespace.

test-case.name: match-143
test-case.description: Test of template matching with document-node(schema-element($name)) where $name has no prefix and it belongs to no namespace.

test-case.name: match-144
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element( * ,$type) where $type has a prefix.

modified.change: add template priorities, caused by bug 27140

test-case.name: match-145
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element( * ,$type) where $type has no prefix. Show effect of @xpath-default-namespace on $type.

modified.change: add template priorities, caused by bug 27140

test-case.name: match-146
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name ,$type) where $name has a prefix.

test-case.name: match-147
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name ,$type) where $name has no prefix. Show effect of @xpath-default-namespace on $name.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name,$type) as the first step in a path expression.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name,$type) as the middle step in a path expression.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name,$type) as the last step in a path expression.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name,$type) with an axis.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name,$type) for user defined atomic types.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with element( * ,$type) for user defined atomic types.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-element($name) where $name has a prefix.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-element($name) where $name has no prefix. Show effect of @xpath-default-namespace on $name.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-element($name) as a middle step in a path expression.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-element($name) with an axis.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with union of several schema-element($name) with different top-level element declaration names.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with document-node(element( * ,$type)) where $type has a prefix.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with document-node(element( * ,$type)) where $type has no prefix. Show effect of @xpath-default-namespace on $type.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with document-node(element($name ,$type)) where $name has a prefix.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with document-node(schema-element($name)) where $name has a prefix.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute( * ,$type) where $type has a prefix.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute( * ,$type) where $type has no prefix. Show effect of @xpath-default-namespace on $type.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute($name ,$type) where $name has a prefix.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute($name,$type) with an axis.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute($name,xs:untypedAtomic) with typed attribute nodes from source file. Stylesheet has @input-type-annotations=strip.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with element( *,$type) with an explicitly created and typed element node with a typed parent.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with "//schema-element($name)" with an explicitly created and typed element node with a typed parent.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with "//attribute($name,$type)" with an explicitly created and typed attribute node without a parent. Does not match.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-attribute($name) with an explicitly created and typed attribute node without a parent.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-attribute($name) with an explicitly created and typed attribute node with a typed parent.

test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-attribute($name) with an explicitly constructed attribute node without a parent and validated with @validation=strict.

test-case.name: match-194
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name,$type) for a user-defined or built-in list type.

test-case.name: match-195
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name,$type) for a user-defined union type.

test-case.name: match-196
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name,$type) for a complex type.

test-case.name: match-197
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name,$type) and element( * ,$type) with a predicate.

test-case.name: match-198
test-case.description: Test of template matching with element($name,xs:untyped) with typed nodes from source file. Stylesheet has @input-type-annotations=strip.

test-case.name: match-199
test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-element($name) for top-level element declarations of user defined atomic types.

test-case.name: match-200
test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-element($name) for top-level element declarations of a complex type. Show all cases where a node will match the pattern

result.assert-xml: <out><A4>My first Book</A4><A5>My first Audio Book</A5><A6>My first Article</A6></out>

test-case.name: match-201
test-case.description: Test of template matching with document-node(element($name,$type)) for a complex type which is the base type of the document element.

test-case.name: match-202
test-case.description: Test of template matching with document-node(schema-element($name)), $name is a top-level element declaration of a user-defined union type.

test-case.name: match-203
test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute( * ,$type) where $type has no prefix and it belongs to no namespace.

test-case.name: match-204
test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-attribute($name) where $name has no prefix and it belongs to no namespace.

test-case.name: match-205
test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute($name ,$type) where $name has no prefix.

test-case.name: match-206
test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute($name ,$type) where $name has no prefix. Show there is no effect of default namespace of stylesheet on $name.

test-case.name: match-207
test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute($name ,$type) where $name has no prefix. Show there is no effect of @xpath-default-namespace on $name.

test-case.name: match-208
test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute($name,$type) for derived built-in atomic types including xs:ID, xs:IDREF, xs:NOTATION, xs:ENTITY.

test-case.name: match-209
test-case.description: Test of template matching with attribute( * ,$type) for xs:IDREFS, xs:NMTOKENS, xs:ENTITIES or a user-defined list type.

test-case.name: match-210
test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-attribute($name) for top-level attribute declarations of derived built-in atomic types. Show all cases where a node will match the pattern

modified.change: expected results depended on order of attributes

test-case.name: match-211
test-case.description: Test of template matching with schema-attribute($name) for top-level attribute declarations of a user-defined union type. Show all cases where a node will match the pattern

The brown fox jumped over the lazy dog.

El zorro marron salto el perro vago.
